member.name: T:Ice.SignalPolicy
member.summary: The signal policy for Ice.Application signal handling.

member.name: F:Ice.SignalPolicy.HandleSignals
member.summary: If a signal is received, Ice.Application reacts to the signal by calling Communicator.destroy or Communicator.shutdown, or by calling a custom shutdown hook installed by the application.

member.name: F:Ice.SignalPolicy.NoSignalHandling
member.summary: Any signal that is received is not intercepted and takes the default action.

member.name: T:Ice.Application
member.summary: Utility base class that makes it easy to correctly initialize and finalize the Ice run time, as well as handle signals. Unless the application specifies a logger, Application installs a per-process logger that logs to the standard error output. Applications must create a derived class that implements the run method. A program can contain only one instance of this class.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.run(System.String[])
member.summary: Called once the communicator has been initialized. The derived class must implement run, which is the application's starting method.
member.param: The argument vector for the application. Application scans the argument vector passed to main for options that are specific to the Ice run time and removes them; therefore, the vector passed to run is free from Ice-related options and contains only options and arguments that are application-specific.
member.returns: The run method should return zero for successful termination, and non-zero otherwise. Application.main returns the value returned by run.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.interruptCallback(System.Int32)
member.summary: Override this method to provide a custom application interrupt hook. You must call callbackOnInterrupt for this method to be called. Note that the interruptCallback can be called concurrently with any other thread (including main) in your application--take appropriate concurrency precautions.
member.param: The cause of the interrupt.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance that calls Communicator.shutdown if a signal is received.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.#ctor(Ice.SignalPolicy)
member.summary: Initializes an instance that handles signals according to the signal policy.
member.param: Determines how to respond to signals.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.main(System.String[])
member.summary: The application must call main after it has instantiated the derived class. main creates a communicator, establishes the specified signal policy, and, once run returns, destroys the communicator. The method prints an error message for any exception that propagates out of run and ensures that the communicator is destroyed correctly even if run completes abnormally.
member.param: The arguments for the application (as passed to Main(string[]) by the operating system.
member.returns: The value returned by run. If run terminates with an exception, the return value is non-zero.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.main(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: The application must call main after it has instantiated the derived class. main creates a communicator, establishes the specified signal policy, and, once run returns, destroys the communicator. The method prints an error message for any exception that propagates out of run and ensures that the communicator is destroyed correctly even if run completes abnormally.
member.param: The arguments for the application (as passed to Main(string[]) by the operating system.
The configuration file with which to initialize Ice properties.
member.returns: The value returned by run. If run terminates with an exception, the return value is non-zero.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.main(System.String[],Ice.InitializationData)
member.summary: The application must call main after it has instantiated the derived class. main creates a communicator, establishes the specified signal policy, and, once run returns, destroys the communicator. The method prints an error message for any exception that propagates out of run and ensures that the communicator is destroyed correctly even if run completes abnormally.
member.param: The arguments for the application (as passed to Main(string[]) by the operating system.
Additional data used to initialize the communicator.
member.returns: The value returned by run. If run terminates with an exception, the return value is non-zero.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.appName
member.summary: Returns the application name (which is also the value of Ice.ProgramName. This method is useful mainly for error messages that include the application name. Because appName is a static method, it is available from anywhere in the program.
member.returns: The name of the application.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.communicator
member.summary: Returns the communicator for the application. Because communicator is a static method, it permits access to the communicator from anywhere in the program. Note that, as a consequence, you cannot have more than one instance of Application in a program.
member.returns: The communicator for the application.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.destroyOnInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application to call Communicator.destroy on receipt of a signal. This is default signal handling policy established by the default constructor.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.shutdownOnInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application to call Communicator.shutdown on receipt of a signal.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.ignoreInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application to ignore signals.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.callbackOnInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application to call interruptCallback on receipt of a signal. The derived class can intercept signals by overriding interruptCallback.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.holdInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application to call to hold signals.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.releaseInterrupt
member.summary: Instructs Application respond to signals. If a signal arrived since the last call to holdInterrupt, it is delivered once you call releaseInterrupt.

member.name: M:Ice.Application.interrupted
member.summary: Determines whether the application shut down intentionally or was forced to shut down due to a signal. This is useful for logging purposes.
member.returns: True if a signal caused the communicator to shut down; false otherwise.

member.name: T:Ice.AMDCallback
member.summary: AMDCallback is the interface from which all AMD callbacks are derived.

member.name: M:Ice.AMDCallback.ice_exception(System.Exception)
member.summary: Indicates to the Ice run time that an operation completed with a run-time exception.
member.param: The encoded Ice run-time exception. Note that, if ex is a user exception, the caller receives UnknownUserException. Use ice_response to raise user exceptions.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.destroy
member.summary: Destroy the communicator. This operation calls shutdown implicitly. Calling destroy cleans up memory, and shuts down this communicator's client functionality and destroys all object adapters. Subsequent calls to destroy are ignored.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.shutdown
member.summary:
Shuts down this communicator's server functionality, which includes the deactivation of all object adapters. (Attempts to use a deactivated object adapter raise ObjectAdapterDeactivatedException.) Subsequent calls to shutdown are ignored.
After shutdown returns, no new requests are processed. However, requests that have been started before shutdown was called might still be active. You can use waitForShutdown to wait for the completion of all requests.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.waitForShutdown
member.summary:
Wait until the application has called shutdown (or destroy). On the server side, this operation blocks the calling thread until all currently-executing operations have completed. On the client side, the operation simply block until another thread has called shutdown or destroy.
A typical use of this operation is to call it from the main thread, which then waits until some other thread calls shutdown. After shut-down is complete, the main thread returns and can do some cleanup work before it finally calls destroy to shut down the client functionality, and then exits the application.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.isShutdown
member.summary: Check whether communicator has been shut down.
member.returns: True if the communicator has been shut down; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.stringToProxy(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a stringified proxy into a proxy. For example, MyCategory/MyObject:tcp -h some_host -p 10000 creates a proxy that refers to the Ice object having an identity with a name "MyObject" and a category "MyCategory", with the server running on host "some_host", port 10000. If the stringified proxy does not parse correctly, the operation throws one of ProxyParseException, EndpointParseException, or IdentityParseException. An appendix in the Ice manual provides a detailed description of the syntax supported by stringified proxies.
member.param: The stringified proxy to convert into a proxy.
member.returns: The proxy, or nil if str is an empty string.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.proxyToString(Ice.ObjectPrx)
member.summary: Convert a proxy into a string.
member.param: The proxy to convert into a stringified proxy.
member.returns: The stringified proxy, or an empty string if obj is nil.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.propertyToProxy(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a set of proxy properties into a proxy. The "base" name supplied in the property argument refers to a property containing a stringified proxy, such as MyProxy=id:tcp -h localhost -p 10000. Additional properties configure local settings for the proxy, such as MyProxy.PreferSecure=1. The "Properties" appendix in the Ice manual describes each of the supported proxy properties.
member.param: The base property name.
member.returns: The proxy.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.proxyToProperty(Ice.ObjectPrx,System.String)
member.summary: Convert a proxy to a set of proxy properties.
member.param: The proxy.
The base property name.
member.returns: The property set.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.stringToIdentity(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a string into an identity. If the string does not parse correctly, the operation throws IdentityParseException.
member.param: The string to convert into an identity.
member.returns: The identity.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.identityToString(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Convert an identity into a string.
member.param: The identity to convert into a string.
member.returns: The "stringified" identity.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.createObjectAdapter(System.String)
member.summary:
Create a new object adapter. The endpoints for the object adapter are taken from the property name.Endpoints.
It is legal to create an object adapter with the empty string as its name. Such an object adapter is accessible via bidirectional connections or by collocated invocations that originate from the same communicator as is used by the adapter.
Attempts to create a named object adapter for which no configuration can be found raise InitializationException.
member.param: The object adapter name.
member.returns: The new object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.createObjectAdapterWithEndpoints(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a new object adapter with endpoints. This operation sets the property name.Endpoints, and then calls createObjectAdapter. It is provided as a convenience function.
Calling this operation with an empty name will result in a UUID being generated for the name.
member.param: The object adapter name.
The endpoints for the object adapter.
member.returns: The new object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.createObjectAdapterWithRouter(System.String,Ice.RouterPrx)
member.summary:
Create a new object adapter with a router. This operation creates a routed object adapter.
Calling this operation with an empty name will result in a UUID being generated for the name.
member.param: The object adapter name.
The router.
member.returns: The new object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.addObjectFactory(Ice.ObjectFactory,System.String)
member.summary:
Add an object factory to this communicator. Installing a factory with an id for which a factory is already registered throws AlreadyRegisteredException.
When unmarshaling an Ice object, the Ice run time reads the most-derived type id off the wire and attempts to create an instance of the type using a factory. If no instance is created, either because no factory was found, or because all factories returned nil, the behavior of the Ice run time depends on the format with which the object was marshaled:
If the object uses the "sliced" format, Ice ascends the class hierarchy until it finds a type that is recognized by a factory, or it reaches the least-derived type. If no factory is found that can create an instance, the run time throws NoObjectFactoryException.
If the object uses the "compact" format, Ice immediately raises NoObjectFactoryException.
The following order is used to locate a factory for a type:
The Ice run-time looks for a factory registered specifically for the type.
If no instance has been created, the Ice run-time looks for the default factory, which is registered with an empty type id.
If no instance has been created by any of the preceding steps, the Ice run-time looks for a factory that may have been statically generated by the language mapping for non-abstract classes.
member.param: The factory to add.
The type id for which the factory can create instances, or an empty string for the default factory.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.findObjectFactory(System.String)
member.summary: Find an object factory registered with this communicator.
member.param: The type id for which the factory can create instances, or an empty string for the default factory.
member.returns: The object factory, or null if no object factory was found for the given id.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.setDefaultRouter(Ice.RouterPrx)
member.summary:
Set a default router for this communicator. All newly created proxies will use this default router. To disable the default router, null can be used. Note that this operation has no effect on existing proxies.
You can also set a router for an individual proxy by calling the operation ice_router on the proxy.
member.param: The default router to use for this communicator.

member.summary: Get the default locator this communicator.
member.returns: The default locator for this communicator.

member.name: M:Ice.Communicator.setDefaultLocator(Ice.LocatorPrx)
member.summary:
Set a default Ice locator for this communicator. All newly created proxy and object adapters will use this default locator. To disable the default locator, null can be used. Note that this operation has no effect on existing proxies or object adapters.
You can also set a locator for an individual proxy by calling the operation ice_locator on the proxy, or for an object adapter by calling the operation setLocator on the object adapter.
member.param: The default locator to use for this communicator.

When Ice.Admin.DelayCreation is greater than 0, it is necessary to call getAdmin() after the communicator is initialized to create the Admin object. Otherwise, the Admin object is created automatically after all the plug-ins are initialized.
member.returns: The main ("") facet of the Admin object; a null proxy if no Admin object is configured.

member.name: M:Ice.Connection.close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Close a connection, either gracefully or forcefully. If a connection is closed forcefully, it closes immediately, without sending the relevant close connection protocol messages to the peer and waiting for the peer to acknowledge these protocol messages.
member.param: If true, close forcefully. Otherwise the connection is closed gracefully.

member.name: M:Ice.Connection.createProxy(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Create a special proxy that always uses this connection. This can be used for callbacks from a server to a client if the server cannot directly establish a connection to the client, for example because of firewalls. In this case, the server would create a proxy using an already established connection from the client.
member.param: The identity for which a proxy is to be created.
member.returns: A proxy that matches the given identity and uses this connection.

member.name: M:Ice.Connection.setAdapter(Ice.ObjectAdapter)
member.summary: Explicitly set an object adapter that dispatches requests that are received over this connection. A client can invoke an operation on a server using a proxy, and then set an object adapter for the outgoing connection that is used by the proxy in order to receive callbacks. This is useful if the server cannot establish a connection back to the client, for example because of firewalls.
member.param: The object adapter that should be used by this connection to dispatch requests. The object adapter must be activated. When the object adapter is deactivated, it is automatically removed from the connection.

member.name: M:Ice.Connection.getAdapter
member.summary: Get the object adapter that dispatches requests for this connection.
member.returns: The object adapter that dispatches requests for the connection, or null if no adapter is set.

member.name: T:Ice.DispatchInterceptor
member.summary: Base class that allows a server intercept incoming requests. The application must derive a concrete class from DispatchInterceptor that implements the DispatchInterceptor.dispatch operation. An instance of this derived class can be registered with an object adapter like any other servant. A dispatch interceptor is useful particularly to automatically retry requests that have failed due to a recoverable error condition.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.getName
member.summary: Get the name of this object adapter.
member.returns: This object adapter's name.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.getCommunicator
member.summary: Get the communicator this object adapter belongs to.
member.returns: This object adapter's communicator.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.activate
member.summary: Activate all endpoints that belong to this object adapter. After activation, the object adapter can dispatch requests received through its endpoints.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.hold
member.summary:
Temporarily hold receiving and dispatching requests. The object adapter can be reactivated with the activate operation.
Holding is not immediate, i.e., after hold returns, the object adapter might still be active for some time. You can use waitForHold to wait until holding is complete.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.waitForHold
member.summary: Wait until the object adapter holds requests. Calling hold initiates holding of requests, and waitForHold only returns when holding of requests has been completed.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.deactivate
member.summary:
Deactivate all endpoints that belong to this object adapter. After deactivation, the object adapter stops receiving requests through its endpoints. Object adapters that have been deactivated must not be reactivated again, and cannot be used otherwise. Attempts to use a deactivated object adapter raise ObjectAdapterDeactivatedException; however, attempts to deactivate an already deactivated object adapter are ignored and do nothing. Once deactivated, it is possible to destroy the adapter to clean up resources and then create and activate a new adapter with the same name.
After deactivate returns, no new requests are processed by the object adapter. However, requests that have been started before deactivate was called might still be active. You can use waitForDeactivate to wait for the completion of all requests for this object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.waitForDeactivate
member.summary: Wait until the object adapter has deactivated. Calling deactivate initiates object adapter deactivation, and waitForDeactivate only returns when deactivation has been completed.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.isDeactivated
member.summary: Check whether object adapter has been deactivated.
member.returns: Whether adapter has been deactivated.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.destroy
member.summary: Destroys the object adapter and cleans up all resources held by the object adapter. If the object adapter has not yet been deactivated, destroy implicitly initiates the deactivation and waits for it to finish. Subsequent calls to destroy are ignored. Once destroy has returned, it is possible to create another object adapter with the same name.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.add(Ice.Object,Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Add a servant to this object adapter's Active Servant Map. Note that one servant can implement several Ice objects by registering the servant with multiple identities. Adding a servant with an identity that is in the map already throws AlreadyRegisteredException.
member.param: The servant to add.
The identity of the Ice object that is implemented by the servant.
member.returns: A proxy that matches the given identity and this object adapter.

member.param: The servant to add.
The identity of the Ice object that is implemented by the servant.
The facet. An empty facet means the default facet.
member.returns: A proxy that matches the given identity, facet, and this object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.addWithUUID(Ice.Object)
member.summary: Add a servant to this object adapter's Active Servant Map, using an automatically generated UUID as its identity. Note that the generated UUID identity can be accessed using the proxy's ice_getIdentity operation.
member.param: The servant to add.
member.returns: A proxy that matches the generated UUID identity and this object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.addFacetWithUUID(Ice.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Like addWithUUID, but with a facet. Calling addWithUUID(servant) is equivalent to calling addFacetWithUUID with an empty facet.
member.param: The servant to add.
The facet. An empty facet means the default facet.
member.returns: A proxy that matches the generated UUID identity, facet, and this object adapter.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.addDefaultServant(Ice.Object,System.String)
member.summary:
Add a default servant to handle requests for a specific category. Adding a default servant for a category for which a default servant is already registered throws AlreadyRegisteredException. To dispatch operation calls on servants, the object adapter tries to find a servant for a given Ice object identity and facet in the following order:
The object adapter tries to find a servant for the identity and facet in the Active Servant Map.
If no servant has been found in the Active Servant Map, the object adapter tries to find a default servant for the category component of the identity.
If no servant has been found by any of the preceding steps, the object adapter tries to find a default servant for an empty category, regardless of the category contained in the identity.
If no servant has been found by any of the preceding steps, the object adapter gives up and the caller receives ObjectNotExistException or FacetNotExistException.
member.param: The default servant.
The category for which the default servant is registered. An empty category means it will handle all categories.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.remove(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Remove a servant (that is, the default facet) from the object adapter's Active Servant Map.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object that is implemented by the servant. If the servant implements multiple Ice objects, remove has to be called for all those Ice objects. Removing an identity that is not in the map throws NotRegisteredException.
member.returns: The removed servant.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.removeFacet(Ice.Identity,System.String)
member.summary: Like remove, but with a facet. Calling remove(id) is equivalent to calling removeFacet with an empty facet.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object that is implemented by the servant.
The facet. An empty facet means the default facet.
member.returns: The removed servant.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.removeAllFacets(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Remove all facets with the given identity from the Active Servant Map. The operation completely removes the Ice object, including its default facet. Removing an identity that is not in the map throws NotRegisteredException.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object to be removed.
member.returns: A collection containing all the facet names and servants of the removed Ice object.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.removeDefaultServant(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the default servant for a specific category. Attempting to remove a default servant for a category that is not registered throws NotRegisteredException.
member.param: The category of the default servant to remove.
member.returns: The default servant.

member.summary: Look up a servant in this object adapter's Active Servant Map by the identity of the Ice object it implements. This operation only tries to look up a servant in the Active Servant Map. It does not attempt to find a servant by using any installed ServantLocator.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object for which the servant should be returned.
member.returns: The servant that implements the Ice object with the given identity, or null if no such servant has been found.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.findFacet(Ice.Identity,System.String)
member.summary: Like find, but with a facet. Calling find(id) is equivalent to calling findFacet with an empty facet.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object for which the servant should be returned.
The facet. An empty facet means the default facet.
member.returns: The servant that implements the Ice object with the given identity and facet, or null if no such servant has been found.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.findAllFacets(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Find all facets with the given identity in the Active Servant Map.
member.param: The identity of the Ice object for which the facets should be returned.
member.returns: A collection containing all the facet names and servants that have been found, or an empty map if there is no facet for the given identity.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.findByProxy(Ice.ObjectPrx)
member.summary: Look up a servant in this object adapter's Active Servant Map, given a proxy. This operation only tries to lookup a servant in the Active Servant Map. It does not attempt to find a servant by using any installed ServantLocator.
member.param: The proxy for which the servant should be returned.
member.returns: The servant that matches the proxy, or null if no such servant has been found.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.addServantLocator(Ice.ServantLocator,System.String)
member.summary:
Add a Servant Locator to this object adapter. Adding a servant locator for a category for which a servant locator is already registered throws AlreadyRegisteredException. To dispatch operation calls on servants, the object adapter tries to find a servant for a given Ice object identity and facet in the following order:
The object adapter tries to find a servant for the identity and facet in the Active Servant Map.
If no servant has been found in the Active Servant Map, the object adapter tries to find a servant locator for the category component of the identity. If a locator is found, the object adapter tries to find a servant using this locator.
If no servant has been found by any of the preceding steps, the object adapter tries to find a locator for an empty category, regardless of the category contained in the identity. If a locator is found, the object adapter tries to find a servant using this locator.
If no servant has been found by any of the preceding steps, the object adapter gives up and the caller receives ObjectNotExistException or FacetNotExistException.
Only one locator for the empty category can be installed.
member.param: The locator to add.
The category for which the Servant Locator can locate servants, or an empty string if the Servant Locator does not belong to any specific category.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.removeServantLocator(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a Servant Locator from this object adapter.
member.param: The category for which the Servant Locator can locate servants, or an empty string if the Servant Locator does not belong to any specific category.
member.returns: The Servant Locator, or throws NotRegisteredException if no Servant Locator was found for the given category.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.findServantLocator(System.String)
member.summary: Find a Servant Locator installed with this object adapter.
member.param: The category for which the Servant Locator can locate servants, or an empty string if the Servant Locator does not belong to any specific category.
member.returns: The Servant Locator, or null if no Servant Locator was found for the given category.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectAdapter.findDefaultServant(System.String)
member.summary: Find the default servant for a specific category.
member.param: The category of the default servant to find.
member.returns: The default servant or null if no default servant was registered for the category.

Otherwise, if no adapter id is defined, the return value is a direct proxy containing this object adapter's published endpoints.

member.name: T:Ice.AMISentCallback
member.summary: Deprecated callback interface for AMI invocations. This is useful for applications that send asynchronous invocations that might not be sent for some time and, therefore, are queued in the Ice run time for transmission. The Ice run time calls ice_sent if an an AMI invocation cannot be written to the transport and was queued for later transmission. Applications that need to implement flow control for AMI invocations can implement this interface on the corresponding AMI callback object.

member.name: M:Ice.AMISentCallback.ice_sent
member.summary: Indicates to the caller of an AMI operation that the invocation was queued for later transmission.

member.returns: The plug-in that was created by this method.

member.name: M:Ice.PluginManager.initializePlugins
member.summary: Initialize the configured plug-ins. The communicator automatically initializes the plug-ins by default, but an application may need to interact directly with a plug-in prior to initialization. In this case, the application must set Ice.InitPlugins=0 and then invoke initializePlugins manually. The plug-ins are initialized in the order in which they are loaded. If a plug-in raises an exception during initialization, the communicator invokes destroy on the plug-ins that have already been initialized.
member.exception: Raised if the plug-ins have already been initialized.

member.name: M:Ice.PluginManager.getPlugins
member.summary: Get a list of plugins installed.
member.returns: The names of the plugins installed.

member.param: The plug-in's name.
member.returns: The plug-in.
member.exception: Raised if no plug-in is found with the given name.

member.name: M:Ice.PluginManager.addPlugin(System.String,Ice.Plugin)
member.summary: Install a new plug-in.
member.param: The plug-in's name.
The plug-in.
member.exception: Raised if a plug-in already exists with the given name.

member.name: T:Ice.ProcessOperations_
member.summary:
An administrative interface for process management. Managed servers must implement this interface.
A servant implementing this interface is a potential target for denial-of-service attacks, therefore proper security precautions should be taken. For example, the servant can use a UUID to make its identity harder to guess, and be registered in an object adapter with a secured endpoint.

member.name: M:Ice.Properties.getPropertyAsList(System.String)
member.summary: Get a property as a list of strings. If the property is not set, an empty list is returned. The strings in the list can contain whitespace if they are enclosed in single or double quotes. If quotes are mismatched, an empty list is returned. Within single quotes or double-quotes, you can escape the quote in question with \, e.g. O'Reilly can be written as O'Reilly, "O'Reilly" or 'O\'Reilly'.
member.param: The property key.
member.returns: The property value interpreted as a list of strings.

member.summary: Get a property as a list of strings. If the property is not set, the default list is returned. member.param: The property key.
The default value to use if the property is not set.
member.returns: The property value interpreted as list of strings, or the default value.

member.returns: The Ice version.

member.name: T:Ice.InitializationException
member.summary: This exception is raised when a failure occurs during initialization.

member.name: T:Ice.PluginInitializationException
member.summary: This exception indicates that a failure occurred while initializing a plug-in.

member.name: T:Ice.CollocationOptimizationException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a feature is requested that is not supported with collocation optimization.

member.name: T:Ice.AlreadyRegisteredException
member.summary: An attempt was made to register something more than once with the Ice run time. This exception is raised if an attempt is made to register a servant, servant locator, facet, object factory, plug-in, object adapter, object, or user exception factory more than once for the same ID.

member.name: T:Ice.NotRegisteredException
member.summary:
An attempt was made to find or deregister something that is not registered with the Ice run time or Ice locator. This exception is raised if an attempt is made to remove a servant, servant locator, facet, object factory, plug-in, object adapter, object, or user exception factory that is not currently registered.
It's also raised if the Ice locator can't find an object or object adapter when resolving an indirect proxy or when an object adapter is activated.

member.name: T:Ice.TwowayOnlyException
member.summary: The operation can only be invoked with a twoway request. This exception is raised if an attempt is made to invoke an operation with ice_oneway, ice_batchOneway, ice_datagram, or ice_batchDatagram and the operation has a return value, out-parameters, or an exception specification.

member.name: T:Ice.CloneNotImplementedException
member.summary: An attempt was made to clone a class that does not support cloning. This exception is raised if ice_clone is called on a class that is derived from an abstract Slice class (that is, a class containing operations), and the derived class does not provide an implementation of the ice_clone operation (C++ only).

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an operation call on a server raises an unknown exception. For example, for C++, this exception is raised if the server throws a C++ exception that is not directly or indirectly derived from Ice::LocalException or Ice::UserException.

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownLocalException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an operation call on a server raises a local exception. Because local exceptions are not transmitted by the Ice protocol, the client receives all local exceptions raised by the server as UnknownLocalException. The only exception to this rule are all exceptions derived from RequestFailedException, which are transmitted by the Ice protocol even though they are declared local.

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownUserException
member.summary: An operation raised an incorrect user exception. This exception is raised if an operation raises a user exception that is not declared in the exception's throws clause. Such undeclared exceptions are not transmitted from the server to the client by the Ice protocol, but instead the client just gets an UnknownUserException. This is necessary in order to not violate the contract established by an operation's signature: Only local exceptions and user exceptions declared in the throws clause can be raised.

member.name: T:Ice.VersionMismatchException
member.summary: This exception is raised if the Ice library version does not match the version in the Ice header files.

member.name: T:Ice.CommunicatorDestroyedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if the Communicator has been destroyed.

member.name: T:Ice.ObjectAdapterDeactivatedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an attempt is made to use a deactivated ObjectAdapter.

member.name: T:Ice.ObjectAdapterIdInUseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an ObjectAdapter cannot be activated. This happens if the Locator detects another active ObjectAdapter with the same adapter id.

member.name: T:Ice.NoEndpointException
member.summary: This exception is raised if no suitable endpoint is available.

member.name: T:Ice.EndpointParseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if there was an error while parsing an endpoint.

member.name: T:Ice.EndpointSelectionTypeParseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if there was an error while parsing an endpoint selection type.

member.name: T:Ice.VersionParseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if there was an error while parsing a version.

member.name: T:Ice.IdentityParseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if there was an error while parsing a stringified identity.

member.name: T:Ice.ProxyParseException
member.summary: This exception is raised if there was an error while parsing a stringified proxy.

member.name: T:Ice.IllegalIdentityException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an illegal identity is encountered.

member.name: T:Ice.RequestFailedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a request failed. This exception, and all exceptions derived from RequestFailedException, are transmitted by the Ice protocol, even though they are declared local.

member.name: T:Ice.ObjectNotExistException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an object does not exist on the server, that is, if no facets with the given identity exist.

member.name: T:Ice.FacetNotExistException
member.summary: This exception is raised if no facet with the given name exists, but at least one facet with the given identity exists.

member.name: T:Ice.OperationNotExistException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an operation for a given object does not exist on the server. Typically this is caused by either the client or the server using an outdated Slice specification.

member.name: T:Ice.SyscallException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a system error occurred in the server or client process. There are many possible causes for such a system exception. For details on the cause, SyscallException.error should be inspected.

member.name: T:Ice.SocketException
member.summary: This exception indicates socket errors.

member.name: T:Ice.FileException
member.summary: This exception indicates file errors.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectFailedException
member.summary: This exception indicates connection failures.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectionRefusedException
member.summary: This exception indicates a connection failure for which the server host actively refuses a connection.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectionLostException
member.summary: This exception indicates a lost connection.

member.name: T:Ice.DNSException
member.summary: This exception indicates a DNS problem. For details on the cause, DNSException.error should be inspected.

member.name: T:Ice.TimeoutException
member.summary: This exception indicates a timeout condition.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectTimeoutException
member.summary: This exception indicates a connection establishment timeout condition.

member.name: T:Ice.CloseTimeoutException
member.summary: This exception indicates a connection closure timeout condition.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectionTimeoutException
member.summary: This exception indicates that a connection has been shut down because it has been idle for some time.

member.name: T:Ice.ProtocolException
member.summary: A generic exception base for all kinds of protocol error conditions.

member.name: T:Ice.BadMagicException
member.summary: This exception indicates that a message did not start with the expected magic number ('I', 'c', 'e', 'P').

member.name: T:Ice.UnsupportedProtocolException
member.summary: This exception indicates an unsupported protocol version.

member.name: T:Ice.UnsupportedEncodingException
member.summary: This exception indicates an unsupported data encoding version.

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownMessageException
member.summary: This exception indicates that an unknown protocol message has been received.

member.name: T:Ice.ConnectionNotValidatedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a message is received over a connection that is not yet validated.

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownRequestIdException
member.summary: This exception indicates that a response for an unknown request ID has been received.

member.name: T:Ice.UnknownReplyStatusException
member.summary: This exception indicates that an unknown reply status has been received.

member.name: T:Ice.CloseConnectionException
member.summary: This exception indicates that the connection has been gracefully shut down by the server. The operation call that caused this exception has not been executed by the server. In most cases you will not get this exception, because the client will automatically retry the operation call in case the server shut down the connection. However, if upon retry the server shuts down the connection again, and the retry limit has been reached, then this exception is propagated to the application code.

member.name: T:Ice.ForcedCloseConnectionException
member.summary: This exception is raised by an operation call if the application forcefully closes the connection Connection.close.

member.name: T:Ice.IllegalMessageSizeException
member.summary: This exception indicates that a message size is less than the minimum required size.

member.name: T:Ice.CompressionException
member.summary: This exception indicates a problem with compressing or uncompressing data.

member.name: T:Ice.DatagramLimitException
member.summary: A datagram exceeds the configured size. This exception is raised if a datagram exceeds the configured send or receive buffer size, or exceeds the maximum payload size of a UDP packet (65507 bytes).

member.name: T:Ice.MarshalException
member.summary: This exception is raised for errors during marshaling or unmarshaling data.

member.name: T:Ice.ProxyUnmarshalException
member.summary: This exception is raised if inconsistent data is received while unmarshaling a proxy.

member.name: T:Ice.UnmarshalOutOfBoundsException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an out-of-bounds condition occurs during unmarshaling.

member.name: T:Ice.NoObjectFactoryException
member.summary: This exception is raised if no suitable object factory was found during unmarshaling of a Slice class instance.

member.name: T:Ice.UnexpectedObjectException
member.summary: This exception is raised if the type of an unmarshaled Slice class instance does not match its expected type. This can happen if client and server are compiled with mismatched Slice definitions or if a class of the wrong type is passed as a parameter or return value using dynamic invocation. This exception can also be raised if IceStorm is used to send Slice class instances and an operation is subscribed to the wrong topic.

member.name: T:Ice.MemoryLimitException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a request size exceeds the limit specified by the Ice.MessageSizeMax property.

member.name: T:Ice.StringConversionException
member.summary: This exception is raised when a string conversion to or from UTF-8 fails during marshaling or unmarshaling.

member.name: T:Ice.EncapsulationException
member.summary: This exception indicates a malformed data encapsulation.

member.name: T:Ice.FeatureNotSupportedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an unsupported feature is used. The unsupported feature string contains the name of the unsupported feature

member.name: T:Ice.SecurityException
member.summary: This exception indicates a failure in a security subsystem, such as the IceSSL plug-in.

member.name: T:Ice.FixedProxyException
member.summary: This exception indicates that an attempt has been made to change the connection properties of a fixed proxy.

member.name: T:Ice.ResponseSentException
member.summary: Indicates that the response to a request has already been sent; re-dispatching such a request is not possible.

member.name: T:Ice.AdapterNotFoundException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an adapter cannot be found.

member.name: T:Ice.InvalidReplicaGroupIdException
member.summary: This exception is raised if the replica group provided by the server is invalid.

member.name: T:Ice.AdapterAlreadyActiveException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a server tries to set endpoints for an adapter that is already active.

member.name: T:Ice.ObjectNotFoundException
member.summary: This exception is raised if an object cannot be found.

member.name: T:Ice.ServerNotFoundException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a server cannot be found.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectFactory.create(System.String)
member.summary:
Create a new object for a given object type. The type is the absolute Slice type id, i.e., the id relative to the unnamed top-level Slice module. For example, the absolute Slice type id for interfaces of type Bar in the module Foo is ::Foo::Bar.
The leading "::" is required.
member.param: The object type.
member.returns: The object created for the given type, or nil if the factory is unable to create the object.

member.name: M:Ice.ObjectFactory.destroy
member.summary: Called when the factory is removed from the communicator, or if the communicator is destroyed.

member.name: T:Ice.ProcessPrxHelper
member.summary:
An administrative interface for process management. Managed servers must implement this interface.
A servant implementing this interface is a potential target for denial-of-service attacks, therefore proper security precautions should be taken. For example, the servant can use a UUID to make its identity harder to guess, and be registered in an object adapter with a secured endpoint.

member.name: M:Ice.ServantLocator.locate(Ice.Current,System.Object@)
member.summary:
Called before a request is dispatched if a servant cannot be found in the object adapter's active servant map. Note that the object adapter does not automatically insert the returned servant into its active servant map. This must be done by the servant locator implementation, if this is desired.
locate can throw any user exception. If it does, that exception is marshaled back to the client. If the Slice definition for the corresponding operation includes that user exception, the client receives that user exception; otherwise, the client receives UnknownUserException.
If locate throws any exception, the Ice run time does not call finished.
If you call locate from your own code, you must also call finished when you have finished using the servant, provided that locate returned a non-null servant; otherwise, you will get undefined behavior if you use servant locators such as the Freeze.Evictor.
member.param: Information about the current operation for which a servant is required.
A "cookie" that will be passed to finished.
member.returns: The located servant, or null if no suitable servant has been found.

member.name: M:Ice.ServantLocator.finished(Ice.Current,Ice.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Called by the object adapter after a request has been made. This operation is only called if locate was called prior to the request and returned a non-null servant. This operation can be used for cleanup purposes after a request.
finished can throw any user exception. If it does, that exception is marshaled back to the client. If the Slice definition for the corresponding operation includes that user exception, the client receives that user exception; otherwise, the client receives UnknownUserException.
If both the operation and finished throw an exception, the exception thrown by finished is marshaled back to the client.
member.param: Information about the current operation call for which a servant was located by locate.
The servant that was returned by locate.
The cookie that was returned by locate.

member.name: M:Ice.ServantLocator.deactivate(System.String)
member.summary: Called when the object adapter in which this servant locator is installed is deactivated.
member.param: Indicates for which category the servant locator is being deactivated.
